page.title: 16TRANSPORT
page.content: The bridge was built near the route of the ferry boats which once connected Inverness to the Black Isle.It is part of the A.9.from Perth to the oil construction yards at Nigg and Kishorn.E.E.C.money helped to pay for it.The Queen Mother opened it on a very wet day in August 1982.It looks very grand and majestic,towering above the Firth like a guardian.Thousands drive over it to the North. The Black Isle people find it much easier to get to work now.A new shopping centre and supermarkets have popped up to serve more customers.The villages are quieter.Their shops have suffered,some are closing.People can now go to Eden Court Theatre and hotels in the evening by car. The old ferry pier is sprouting weeds. Older people liked the ferry better.It was easier to walk down to the ferry.
